title: AGENTS.md
text: condathis R package designed simplify execution command-line interface (CLI) tools within isolated reproducible environments. package’s primary goal solve reproducibility dependency-conflict problems arise calling system tools R. achieves using micromamba create manage sandboxed Conda environments, allowing R users run CLI tool specific dependencies. Core Functionality: Create isolated Conda environments (create_env()). Run CLI commands within specified environment (run()). Manage environments installations within R. Key Technologies: Language: R (requires R ≥ 4.3) Core External Tool: micromamba (package already manages internally). processx: running managing external processes (like micromamba). withr: managing state environment variables execution. fs: file system operations. cli: creating rich command-line user interface, including error messages. Testing: testthat (≥ 3.0.0). Task Runner: just (justfile present repository).

title: Introduction to condathis
text: Running command-line (CLI) tools R can powerful way extend analysis, often comes challenges. ensure tool installed? manage dependencies without conflicting software system? make analysis reproducible others? condathis package designed solve problems. allows run CLI tool sandboxed, reproducible environment, powered micromamba. vignette provides brief introduction core functionality condathis. Imagine want analyze BAM file using samtools, popular bioinformatics tool. write R script calls samtools using system(), approach drawbacks: Dependency Hell: script depends samtools installed available system’s PATH. share script colleague, need install manually, might install different version, lead different results. Conflicts: Installing samtools dependencies might conflict tools already installed system. Reproducibility: ’s hard guarantee analysis run way different machines later time, software environment explicitly defined. condathis solves creating isolated environments tools. Let’s see use run samtools. First, ’ll create Conda environment contains samtools. can create_env(). ’ll specify packages need (case, samtools bioconda channel). command : Install micromamba ’s already available (don’t worry, ’s single, self-contained executable won’t interfere system). Create new Conda environment named samtools-env. Install samtools environment. Now environment, can use run() execute samtools commands. condathis includes example BAM file can use demonstration. Let’s use samtools view inspect header example BAM file. run() function takes care finding correct environment executing command inside . output command printed R console. complete, reproducible example. using condathis, get: Isolation: Dependencies tool kept separate, avoiding conflicts. Reproducibility: R script now defines creates exact software environment needs. Anyone can run script get results. Simplicity: can manage everything within R, without needing manually use command line manage Conda environments. condathis powerful tool making R analyses rely external command-line tools robust reproducible.
code: create_env(   packages = "samtools",   channels = c("bioconda", "conda-forge"),   env_name = "samtools-env" ) # Get the path to the example BAM file bam_file <- system.file("extdata", "example.bam", package = "condathis")  # Run samtools view -H on the BAM file run("samtools", "view", "-H", bam_file, env_name = "samtools-env") # Load the package library(condathis)  # Create an environment with samtools create_env(   packages = "samtools",   channels = c("bioconda", "conda-forge"),   env_name = "samtools-env" )  # Get the path to the example BAM file bam_file <- system.file("extdata", "example.bam", package = "condathis")  # Run samtools to view the header run(   "samtools", "view", "-H", bam_file,   env_name = "samtools-env" )  # Clean up the environment remove_env("samtools-env")

title: Create a Conda Environment — create_env
text: packages Character vector. Names packages, version strings necessary, e.g. 'python=3.13'. use packages argument assumes env_file used. env_file Character. Path YAML file Conda Environment description. argument used, packages argument included command. env_name Character. Name Conda environment packages going installed. Defaults 'condathis-env'. channels Character vector. Names channels included. default 'c("bioconda", "conda-forge")' used solving dependencies. method Character. Backend method run micromamba, default "auto" running "native" micromamba binaries installed condathis. argument soft deprecated changing really anything. additional_channels Character. Additional Channels added default ones. platform Character. Platform search packages. Defaults NULL use current platform. E.g. "linux-64", "linux-32", "osx-64", "win-64", "win-32", "noarch". Note: Apple Silicon MacOS use "osx-64" instead "osx-arm64" Rosetta 2 available packages available "osx-arm64". verbose Character string specifying verbosity level function's output. Acceptable values : "output": Print standard output error command-line tool screen. Note order standard output error lines may correct, standard output typically buffered. "silent": Suppress output internal command-line tools. Equivalent FALSE. "cmd": Print internal command(s) passed command-line tool. standard output /error redirected file ignored, echoed. Equivalent TRUE. "full": Print internal command(s) ("cmd") standard output error ("output"). Logical values FALSE TRUE also accepted backward compatibility soft-deprecated. Please use "silent" "output" instead. overwrite Logical. environment always overwritten? Defaults FALSE.
